p: While the only known reservoir forVARV is humans, it has been postulated that the virus emerged from an ancestral rodent-borne poxvirus more than 10,000 years ago [ 18, 50]. Numerous smallpox epidemics have occurred throughout recorded history including more than 300 million fatalities during the twentieth century alone [ 51– 53]. Smallpox was eventually eradicated following the implementation of the Smallpox Eradication Program by the WHO from 1966 to 1980 (Fig. 5.2d) which was facilitated by the absence of a zoonotic reservoir for VARV [ 51].
